lg.l: I have been to-day in the temple
Of the everlasting snow,
Raised in the golden morning
Of the æons of long ago.
I have seen the pure ice altar,
White as an angel’s wing,
And the smoke of the foam uprises
As when the censers swing.
I have heard the choir of the torrents
Answering each to each,
Sounding afar to the heavens,
Higher than heart can reach.
And ever and aye in the anthem
The mighty avalanche roar
Pealed through the pillars eternal
That stand at the temple door.
The great high priest Aorangi
Stands in the temple of prayer,
Lifts his white mantle to heaven
Till the soul of man be as fair.
